member.name: T:Sasa.Collections.Mutable.UnionFind
member.remarks:
This data structure is used to determine connected components.
According to [1], this Rem algorithm is the fastest even though it has suboptimal big-O complexity.
[1] http://folk.uib.no/mpa002/SEA2010.pdf

member.name: M:Sasa.Collections.Mutable.UnionFind.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.param: The number of nodes in the graph.

member.name: M:Sasa.Collections.Mutable.UnionFind.Union(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Declare a connection between nodes and .

member.name: M:Sasa.Collections.Mutable.UnionFind.IsConnected(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Checks whether two nodes are connected.
member.returns: True if and are transitively connected.

member.name: M:Sasa.Collections.Mutable.UnionFind.Find(System.Int32)
member.summary: Find the root component of the graph.
member.param: The node to start the search.
member.returns: The root of the subgraph.

member.name: M:Sasa.Collections.Mutable.UnionFind.Save
member.returns: A marker via which we can revert any future changes and return to the current state.

member.name: P:Sasa.Collections.Mutable.UnionFind.Count
member.summary: The number of nodes in the graph.

member.name: P:Sasa.Collections.Mutable.UnionFind.Roots
member.summary: The current roots of the graph from which all nodes can be visited.

member.name: P:Sasa.Collections.Mutable.UnionFind.Closure
member.summary: The set of unique pairs of transitively connected nodes.

member.name: T:Sasa.Collections.WaitQueue`1
member.summary: A queue that implements blocking pulls.
member.typeparam: The type of the queue elements.
member.remarks: This basically implements an actor mailbox, where a thread will block trying to pull the next message until one becomes available.

member.name: T:Sasa.Collections.Trie`2
member.summary: A trie implementing an immutable key-value dictionary interface.
member.remarks:
The core implementation of this hash array mapped trie came from Jules Jacobs. A running dialogue between us then filled in the rest.
This trie is now the fastest immutable dictionary I'm aware of. Faster than ImmutableDictionary, even using the builder method, faster than the previous HAMT, faster than the F# collections, and so on. Lookup is actually almost as fast as a mutable dictionary.

member.name: M:Sasa.Collections.Trie`2.Count
member.returns: The number of entries in the trie.

member.returns: True if the key is in the trie, false otherwise.
